data.title: [android] Optimize preload of AudioEngine
data.body:
Goal:
- Support to play audio without audio is totally decoded, it means that decode some frames, buffering them and send them to OpenSLES to play. Decoding & playing will be simultaneous.
- One strategy for preloading & playing audio, it will only uses `PcmAudioPlayer` to play audio, `UrlAudioPlayer` will be deprecated and only be used in devices which don't support decoding by OpenSLES API.

data.title: fixed #16192: Crash while decoding small MP3 file on Android.
iconv uses the LGPL License (conflicts with the MIT License)
data.body:
Specifically CCFontAtlas uses the iconv library, which is under the LGPL License:
https://www.gnu.org/software/libiconv/

This conflicts with the MIT License, as well as meaning it shouldn't be publishable on an Appstore etc.

Seems like iconv needs to be replaced?

data.title: TrianglesCommands can't do batching when the glprogram using custom shader with custom uniforms
data.body:
In file CCRenderer.cpp, line 876, 2dx checks the MaterialID of the command, and if "newMaterialID == MATERIAL_ID_DO_NOT_BATCH" the command will not do batching.
In file CCTrianglesCommand.cpp, line 81, if the glprogram use custom uniforms, the meterialID will be set to MATERIAL_ID_DO_NOT_BATCH, which means the command will never do batching.
In the latest version of Spine ,it uses CCTrianglesCommands for rendering, so when I use custom shaders for Spine, it will not do any batching because of the custom uniforms, and it will cost more than 30 drawcalls for a single Spine node in my program, which is really a big problem.
I think both the 2dx and Spine need to do something to fix this problem.
@minggo

data.title: WinRT: update libcocos2d version to v3.13
data.body: This pull request updates the Windows 10 UWP and Windows 8.1-Universal versions of libcocos2d to version 3.13 as needed by the Windows Store for version tracking.

data.title: cpp-empty-test does not compile on OS X
data.body:
The empty project does not compile on OS X (10.11.4).
I see these errors in `CCDevice-apple.mm`:

![xcode-error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19324622/17147041/293d36ee-5361-11e6-94ec-8399a63530fb.png)
- cocos2d-x version: 3.12
- devices test on: Mac book air 2013
- developing environments
  - Xcode version: 6.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  cocos new -l cpp TEST
2. Open the Xcode project and run on Mac OS

data.title: fix CCImage premultipliedAlpha for ETC format
data.body:
translucent part of ETC format textures are rendered too bright due to
the fact that v3.12 sets PremultipliedAlpha to true by default. This
commit sets default value of _hasPremultipliedAlpha = false, deletes
unnecessary `_hasPremultipliedAlpha = false` code in multiple places,
making ETC format's _hasPremultipliedAlpha false while keeping other
formats unchanged.

data.title: Got wrong result when render sprite which in transformed node to cc.RenderTexture
Remove unnecessary 'extern' to prevent compiler warnings
data.body:
I get the following two warnings when compiling the latest v3 branch on Xcode 7.3.1 and Android NDK r11c (Clang):

```
cocos/renderer/ccShader_ETC1AS_PositionTextureColor.frag:26:20: 'extern' variable has an initializer [-Wextern-initializer]
cocos/renderer/ccShader_ETC1AS_PositionTextureGray.frag:26:20: 'extern' variable has an initializer [-Wextern-initializer]
```

and I have the same warnings when compiling with GCC on Linux:

```
cocos/renderer/ccShader_ETC1AS_PositionTextureColor.frag:26:20: warning: ‘ccETC1ASPositionTextureColor_frag’ initialized and declared ‘extern’
cocos/renderer/ccShader_ETC1AS_PositionTextureGray.frag:26:20: warning: ‘ccETC1ASPositionTextureGray_frag’ initialized and declared ‘extern’
```

This patch removes unnecessary `extern` keywords to prevent the warnings.
Thanks.

data.title: Different behavior of AudioEngine on different platfroms
fixed #16169: new android project crash in android 5.0.2 device (Nexus 7) when use 3.12
data.body: While using clang compiler with gnustl_static on android, the copy assignment operator of `std::u16string` will affect the memory validity, it means after `newChars` is destroyed, the memory of `u16Text` holds will be a dead region. `u16text` represents the variable in `Label::_utf16Text`, when somewhere allocates memory by `malloc, realloc, new, new[]`, the generated memory address may be the same as `Label::_utf16Text` holds. If doing a `memset` or other memory operations, the orignal `Label::_utf16Text` will be in an unknown state. Meanwhile, a bunch lots of logic which depends on `Label::_utf16Text` will be broken.

data.body: This pull request fixes several spelling errors in variable names. It also doesn't break backwards compatibility. Thanks!

data.title: Can't install on OSX
data.body:
according to readme:
MacBook-Pro-Apple:cocos2d-x-3.12 apple$ cocos new -l cpp -p com.gamefromscratch.gamename -d ~/Documents/Projects/cocos2d gamename
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/apple/Downloads/cocos2d-x-3.12/tools/cocos2d-console/bin/cocos.py", line 22, in <module>
    import cocos_project
  File "/Users/apple/Downloads/cocos2d-x-3.12/tools/cocos2d-console/bin/cocos_project.py", line 4, in <module>
    import cocos
  File "/Users/apple/Downloads/cocos2d-x-3.12/tools/cocos2d-console/bin/cocos.py", line 936, in <module>
    language, encoding = locale.getlocale()
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/locale.py", line 562, in getlocale
    return _parse_localename(localename)
  File "/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/locale.py", line 475, in _parse_localename
    raise ValueError, 'unknown locale: %s' % localename
ValueError: unknown locale: UTF-8

Iwanted just create iOS project but it doesn't work

data.title: cocs2d-x v. [3.12] -
data.body:
cocos2d/external/json/document.h

When using an unsigned long variable for buffer size and using the NetworkWrapper function sendData() and recieveData() the crash occurs on recieving and interpreting the buffer. 

Assertion failed: (IsNumber()), function GetDouble, file ~/cocos2d/external/json/document.h, line 1402.

Possible problem that interpreter does not handle unsigned long
